column4: hey, can anyone tell me what the difference is between regular and recovery modes?
recovery mode is single-user mode, when root needs to fix stuff
what happens when you boot into "normal" mode?
it locks up as soon as it starts gdm, although it's not just due to gdm, because when I did a custom install and booted into regular mode, it locked up after attempting to configure x windows
Intel i830... isn't that one that 2.6 has problems with?
are you sure it's not asking for your password?
Under Network Tools I clicked configure on one of my ethernet cards (trying to get my wireless card configured)
Please enter your password that need your user password
It says please enter root password, I tried mine first
that's not supposed to be the case
I figured that... I'll search on bugzilla...
system configuration programs like that are supposed to ask for the user password.  The first user created during install has priveleges to run those apps.
I got it... I ran sudo passwd to set the root password and am using that...
